titles.title: Clean Hydrogen Deployment Act of 2021
Clean Hydrogen Deployment Act of 2021
To direct the Secretary of Energy to establish a pilot program to enter into contracts for payment of costs associated with using eligible hydrogen, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

bill.summary:
Clean Hydrogen Deployment Act of 2021
This bill requires the Department of Energy's Office of Fossil Energy and Carbon Management to establish a pilot program that supports the development of clean hydrogen as an energy source. Under the pilot program, the office must enter into contracts with entities to pay for their costs associated with the production or purchase of clean hydrogen. Clean hydrogen must be produced with at least 80% fewer greenhouse gas emissions than conventional hydrogen.
